content.raw: We have quite a few contact sensors in ARIAC. The sdf for the sensors doesn't use the `<always_on>` tag (because the contact sensor tutorial doesn't mention it). From what I understand, these sensors will stop working with this PR, is that right? We can update the sensors to use the `<always_on>` tag, but other users in the same situation wouldn't be aware of the change.
content.html: We have quite a few contact sensors in ARIAC. The sdf for the sensors doesn't use the <always_on> tag (because the contact sensor tutorial doesn't mention it). From what I understand, these sensors will stop working with this PR, is that right? We can update the sensors to use the <always_on> tag, but other users in the same situation wouldn't be aware of the change.

content.raw: Since we're not using the `<always_on>` tag, we are probably supposed to call `setActive(true)` on each contact sensor, but since they always defaulted to active, we don't do this (and other users might be in the situation).
content.html: Since we're not using the <always_on> tag, we are probably supposed to call setActive(true) on each contact sensor, but since they always defaulted to active, we don't do this (and other users might be in the situation).

content.raw:
I'm trying to understand how it is working for your use case, because what I understand from [this](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2695/contact-sensor-performance-improvement/diff#Lgazebo/sensors/Sensor.ccF96) line is that the `<always on>` logic was already there.

How are you using the sensor? Are you subscribing to the sensor topic?
content.html:
I'm trying to understand how it is working for your use case, because what I understand from this line is that the <always on> logic was already there.

How are you using the sensor? Are you subscribing to the sensor topic?

content.raw:
There is a subtlety in how sensors become `Active`. Take a look at `ContactSensor::IsActive`. This function will return true if there is a subscriber on `contactsPub`. 

In this PR, `contactsPub` is not created until `SetActive` is called.

We should create `contactsPub` on `Load`, and alter the logic the logic here to create the contact filters.
content.html:
There is a subtlety in how sensors become Active. Take a look at ContactSensor::IsActive. This function will return true if there is a subscriber on contactsPub.

In this PR, contactsPub is not created until SetActive is called.

We should create contactsPub on Load, and alter the logic the logic here to create the contact filters.

content.raw: I'll take a stab at making this change.
content.html: I'll take a stab at making this change.

content.raw: Updated here: 80184c7
content.html: Updated here: 80184c7

content.raw: My change creates the publishers and filters on load, but does not subscribe to the filter util active. This change should take advantage of [this line](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/6c3209d9404e8f77e9e0538a6c661a67e984a68a/gazebo/physics/ContactManager.cc?at=gazebo7&fileviewer=file-view-default#ContactManager.cc-138) in the contact manager.
content.html: My change creates the publishers and filters on load, but does not subscribe to the filter util active. This change should take advantage of this line in the contact manager.

content.raw: Nice catch, I'm not exactly sure what this test is checking now, it used to set active and then inactive in ee3690d but the test was changed in  80184c7. Taking a look now.
content.html: Nice catch, I'm not exactly sure what this test is checking now, it used to set active and then inactive in ee3690d but the test was changed in 80184c7. Taking a look now.

content.raw:
The first version of the pull request used to advertise / unadvertise topics on demand, so the test used to call `SetActive(true)` and `SetActive(false)` and see that topics appeared / disappeared in between.

The latest changes make the topic be always advertised, as usual, but the sensor only subscribes to the filtered messages on demand. I changed the test to test this in 8540ba3
content.html:
The first version of the pull request used to advertise / unadvertise topics on demand, so the test used to call SetActive(true) and SetActive(false) and see that topics appeared / disappeared in between.

The latest changes make the topic be always advertised, as usual, but the sensor only subscribes to the filtered messages on demand. I changed the test to test this in 8540ba3
